title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A gpu issues
message:
I have a MBP here.

History: Previously going into kernel panic and having graphic issues. Customer done work around u8900 with bad results - components moved - some connections bridged etc - its been fixed now.

Machine does boot with image but no backlight. Upon testing some voltages

I can see GPU_3.3, IFPX IOVDD, GPUVCORE are all outputting 3.3v???? how is this possible?

title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A gpu issues
message: Voltage on L8930 is 3V? No way!

title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A gpu issues
message:
i was measuring off c8930
its now at .9v

man i was on idiot mode yesterday :(

title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A gpu issues
message:
Okay - non lazy version: Basically i got video out. No backlight. I can see apple logo with torch. Also external display is present.

here are the voltages

ppbus_g3h 12.62v
pp3v42 3.4v
pp3v3_s0 3.34v
pp5v_s0 5.06v
pin 1 on lcd connector 0v

ppbus_sw_bkl 0v

bklt_en 100mV
bkl_sw 80mV

c9711 3.3v present
c9710 5v present

f9700 12.6v on both side

q9706 getting 12.6v on pin 3 and 4 but im getting 0v on 1-2-5-6

title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A gpu issues
message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 36927"]LCD_BKLT_EN present? PRAM reset done?[/QUOTE]

pram done - nothing on lcd_bklt_en

according to what customer said he only worked around the u8900. now the guy doesnt have microscope he bridged a connection and some components were removed. I will re-check this area. Duke do you think it could be something in this area that is affecting smc in anyway? or smc straight out screwed?

title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A gpu issues
message:
U8900 has nothing to do with backlight if all rails it produces are present.

EG_BKLT_EN present? It could be a MUX or GPU problem if hot air was applied to the area. You are checking these voltages with an LCD connected I hope.

title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A gpu issues
message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 36978"]U8900 has nothing to do with backlight if all rails it produces are present.

EG_BKLT_EN present? It could be a MUX or GPU problem if hot air was applied to the area. You are checking these voltages with an LCD connected I hope.[/QUOTE]

forgive me i was teting without LCd connector :eek:
with lcd connector connector EG_BKLT_EN and LCD_BKLT_EN present

title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A gpu issues
message: PWOARRRRRR. found problem. pin 1 was bent on lcd connector so far back. only spotted under microscope. full working now thanks for ur help duke legendary as always.

title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A gpu issues
message: You should have measures 50V at pin 1 from the start indicating an open backlight circuit.

title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A gpu issues
message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 37037"]You should have measures 50V at pin 1 from the start indicating an open backlight circuit. [/QUOTE]

yeh my bad thanks
